column4: anyone else getting a "cannot authenticate" error when apt-get 'ting?
only if youre using not official repos that you didnt authenticate...
could you pastebin your sources.list (just to be sure)
hmm, they are default indeed, very strange that you get authenticaion error :/
never heard about such file... mv it to another name and try apt-get again, just for test...
ah it in youre home dir, you may remove it (AFAIK)
then please dont say " ~/sources.list.d"
do apt-get and pastebin the error...
cant compute, please rephrase...
or do "sudo apt-get clean" and then again, then it should show where it gets the package
yeah, it will propably show that error again, but atleas i would see from where it gets the package... if its "official" package, you may found a bug... or something else is bad...
if you did "sudo apt-get clean" it should donwload the package again, and it should show from where it doeanloads it...
the later
hmm...
well, i get like "Get:1 http://de.archive.ubuntu.com dapper/main libgtk1.2-dev 1.2.10-18 [1147kB] "
those shouldnt touch apt-get atall
do "sudo apt-get clean" and then the other apt-get and pastebin the output
hmm, very strange... try both commands alone (not with &&)
thats very strange, as the "sudo apt-get clean" wouldnt work...
have you done some "not ubuntu way" things lately ?
hmm, very strange. sounds like a bug...
heres how it looks like here http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/17997
it could be something wrong with the repo, but i normally get a 404 when that happens...
np
